messages.content: Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Once we were past the sticker shock of hotels in NYC (espec on Marathon weekend), we were thrilled with our experience at The Pearl.  Front desk staff and bellmen could not have been friendlier or more helpful. My apologies if I don't get names correct, but Kelvin (?) stood out as interested and customer-focused. Just the person you'd want as the face of your hotel brand. Breakfast was included and truly outstanding.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Best hotel choice in Manhattan IMO. Great location, reasonably priced, excellent staff, generously sized rooms. Decor is uninspiring, but also completely unobjectionable. Bed was comfortable. Had a delicious, quiet meal in the hotel restaurant. This was our 4th trip and we'll choose it again the next time we're in NYC.

The views of the city are stunning, and the location superb close to the city main attractions on a walking distance. In addition, the staff is really warm and helpful assisting on every need you have.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

My husband and I spent a week at the Warwick at the end of October. Our room was large and comfortable and we had a pleasant stay. The hotel is well located and walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and Rockefeller Center. The MOMA is around the corner. The staff were friendly and helpful. The elevators are small and in high demand in the mornings but the staff showed us to another set of elevators as we were departing which made it much easier to manage with our suitcases. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it was pricey, but there are several nearby options.  This is not a new, modern, hotel but an older building with history, charm and a few quirks. We found its room rate to be relatively reasonable compared with similar properties and would be happy to return. …

Pros - Great location for tourists, nice sized room and beds (paid a fortune), valet service Cons - Terrible breakfast for a 4-star hotel (just to-go options), inadequate room amenities, barely any space in the front to park temporarily to unload luggage from car
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

I would recommend this hotel as a base for a stay in New York.  The location was close enough to Times Square to be in a good position to get to all places, but not too close that it was noisy.  The rooms were clean and compact and had everything we needed for our trip. Staff were helpful and friendly.

I stayed here from December 28 to January 2nd, they took $500 for deposit and I just received back $300. I never used the restaurant or something where they could charged me and take the money from my deposit. Ive called many times to ask them why they didnt send the full amout and they dont answer. Please make yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel

Be warned, the Hotel charges you a 150 deposit without giving this back, despite nothing being wrong in the room! This is a joke and now they don't even email back in relation. I would note recommend this hotel at all on the basis.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Exceptionally, I would like to share my experience at the Square Hotel regarding the staff and not the facilities. I would especially like to thank Cristaly & Dalia for their great help during my stay in NY. Indeed, they helped me when none of my credit cards were working. They took time to reassure me and find a solution. Again, a very big thank you to them2. Without them, the stay could not have been what it was.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Hotel ticked all the boxes for what we needed. Clean, comfortable, rooms were small but worth it for the location. Sheets were changed every day. Check-in was easy. Air-con/heating was a little difficult to work. Gym in the hotel was very convenient.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

This place was incredible. The room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed and the bathroom was incredible. I'm 5'6" and I was able to lay almost flat in the bathtub. We stayed in a room on a high floor and the view was just amazing. We didn't close the curtains once just so we could see out! I was here on business and we used the meeting rooms and catering and both were also fantastic. The hotel is really beautiful and in a convenient location. Staff was incredibly attentive and kind. Looking forward to staying here again some day!
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

The hotel was ok. I had been tossing up between a few in the area with similar pricing and Selina was the cheapest (but not by too much) and it looked modern. We stayed in a standard and felt it wasn’t worth the price we paid. Wish we had splurged just a couple extra dollars for another hotel. The restaurant across the road is really good though and the location in general is good. Walkable and close to public transport. The room was clean enough but felt a bit off, and also lots of things were broken like light switches. Also they took $100 for incidentals at check in which is fine (they also took a resort fee that was never listed anywhere, $50). But a week after check out, the $100 was still being held. So I contacted them and they said it would be returned within 5-6 days max. 3 weeks later and it is still being held. I contacted them again and they have not answered. Considering they responded almost immediately up until it had to do with them keeping my money, it’s a bit shady. Would love a response.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

We stayed at the Kitano Hotel for 6 days and had a wonderful experience again!  We have stayed at this location a few times.  It is centrally located near Grand Central Station and it’s so easy to get to many of the NY City attractions from this location.  All of the staff are so friendly and helpful.  With room views of either Park Avenue or the Empire State Building, these are add bonuses.  The rooms are very clean and the hotel is elegant.  We traveled with family and several other couples.  Everyone enjoyed their stay and the hospitality.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Great staff , great location and very clean . Staff is very well trained and helps you with all your needs . Great food and concierge also . It’s well worth it this is the only hotel I stay at I will always come back .
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

My husband and I stayed here for a week in August. We had been a wee bit apprehensive, just because of the 2 stars. The hotel far surpassed out expectations. The staff couldn't do enough for us, the bed was fabulously comfy, there was no noise from other rooms and it was spotlessly clean. We loved the location,literally round the corner from the Flat Iron building, five mins from a supermarket (great as the room had a fridge and coffee machine), subway within 2-3 mins and the Highline close by. Yes, you can hear the fire doors when people are moving about, but we never woke through the night. Plenty eateries nearby and a lovely lit view of the ESB at night from the park nearby. Would recommend and stay again without a second thought if we ever come back.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

This little gem is our go to hotel for business and personal stays in NYC.  I love the European flair, and the little extras -- chocolates, water with fresh fruit, hot chocolate, plush robe... The staff is friendly and eager to please.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

We had a wonderful experience at the Blue Moon Hotel. The room was beautiful and the whole hotel is sensitively restored. The owner and staff were friendly and helpful. We had a great time exploring the neighborhood and appreciated the staff recommendations for places to eat and drink. We will certainly return.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

I found the property exceptionally well-maintained, clean, and decorated in the period of New York's Jazz Age. I stayed in the Thelonius Monk Room - it was restored and featured unique little touches, photographs, a cigar box, antiques. The public areas are beautifully furnished; all the guest rooms are named after jazz greats.I had no problem with reservations or confirmations. It is only about 20 minutes from La Guardia, and reasonably close to subway trains. It is literally around the corner from the Apollo Theater!The vibes were so good - I felt like I was staying in a place that was a piece of history.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Only a flying visit for one night due to changes with our flight. We’ve stayed at hard rock hotels in Europe (London before it closed & Ibiza) and this hotel is amazing. Just off the main chunk of time square & 4 mins walk to Rockefeller centre. The staff are so so so kind and friendly! We checked out of our previous hotel and came to the hard rock to drop our bags off as it was around 2/3 hours before check in, the guys at the concierge said we should go up and check in on our room and see when it’ll be ready. We did and they let us check in straight away! They also noted it was my birthday two days before and sent up some birthday cupcakes :) the room was comfortable and very clean. King room with a balcony - our balcony had views of Times Square. The next morning we asked when checkout was, as our tv was showing 12pm. The front desk said it’s usually 11am but they are more than happy to honour the 12pm which gave us some breathing space to be able to figure out how to get to jfk as it was our first time in NYC. Checkout was smooth and easy. Would definitely stay here again!…

This is my fourth stay at NoMo It’s always incredible The vibe The staff The balcony terrace off the room was outstanding! Best city view! All of it!  I recommend 10 out of 10! Thx for a great stay as usual!!
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

We loved staying at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi in NYC. We were immediately met by the most welcoming doorman, Will. He was such a help to us during our stay. His positive vibe and smile made our trip extra special. Derrick the doorman was so nice and accommodating as well! All the hotel staff were great. Our room was very comfortable, and we had everything we needed. We enjoyed dinner at L'Amico restaurant before we left. The service was terrific, and we loved our seafood pasta dishes. We can't wait to come back!

Stayed in the Grand Central 6 years ago and it hasn't changed. Rooms still old fashioned and tired. Badly in need of investment. Air conditioning is as noisy now as it was then. The plastic paddy bar as in need of a good deep clean like it was back then. It claims to be Irish hospitality in New York but most Irish hotels would be far better than this.

I had a fantastic stay here. Room, staff, good, facilities and location were all perfect for my needs. I had a great stay! In particular I loved the cute little breakfast cafe, the staff, food and coffee were all excellent. Room service was good and I slept really well in the comfy bed!

Awesome 7th Avenue location, between Central Park and Times Square!  Broadway close!  What a city.  Checked in super-early.  Later, we asked to move rooms - went to reception and no questions asked, they moved us immediately.  Very good customer service, thank you.  We looked down onto 7th Avenue and that was magic for us to see people moving around.    It was great to have a  bath.  No fridge or tea / coffee making facilities, plastic cups only, a NYC thing?  Ice machine down the hall.    Room for improvement?  The elevators are a disaster!
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Over all rating of stay was average. Rooms are small but very clean, beds are comfy. There in a tiny lobby where ony 2 people can wait. We were in group of 8 and the process of check in was long. During our stay elevator don't work for a few times. We have had to use very narrow and not comfortable stairs. No restaurant in the hotel - only Starbucks.

Great location and clean rooms.  Our room needs some maintenance - light box and outlets on headboard are loose and not working properly.   Frustrating experience with valet parking.  Have stayed 3 times, 2 nights each using valet parking.  Each time charged extra for 'oversized' even though by the garage's owner criteria my car is 'regular'.  This time I complained to the hotel out of principle.  The manager's response was she couldn't do anything because it's up to the garage.  Was escalated to director of operations who also said nothing could be done except they could suggest other garages if I stayed again or could help with conversation with garage at the outset.  Well, I'm not comfortable driving in Manhattan to other garages which is why I like the valet parking and don't use my car until we check-out.  And, as a customer of the hotel I don't want or should have to deal with the garage.  Bottom-line, no acknowledgement or even empathy of the the frustration.  No offer from the hotel to correct the matter now or for future consideration. Nothing.  …
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Charged a smoking fee despite not smoking in the room whatsoever. When we reached out to the hotel, they claimed their head house keeper was on another floor, and it was their call. It’s been several days and we have yet to hear back from the hotel. Just do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

The room was small but clean.  The best part was the quietness of the room, even with being in the heart of NYC. Close to theatres, subway, shopping.  The food and drinks were excellent.  Shona seemed to be there nearly every moment we were in a common area and she was so friendly and helpful. Made us feel like we were welcome and family! Food in the pub and restaurant was excellent. Lots of beers on tap.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

It was nice to wake up and know immediately we were in New York – I mean as opposed to some generic hotel-chain room. The rooms are not beautiful, but the whole place exudes history – and it's fun to know that (like the Chelsea Hotel) lots of famous people (musicians etc.) stayed here. Perfectly located in charming Greenwich Village and handy for Wall Street, Chelsea etc., but quite a schlepp for mid-town etc - at least if you favour walking (as we do). In its favour, it is pretty cheap by NYC standards, and we were lucky to get a stay-6-pay-for-5-nights deal. Helpful, informative staff. Also, on our last night we were lucky to witness the lighting of the Christmas tree in lovely Washington Square park – just a 2-minute walk away. Read my separate review of their restaurant (North Square).
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

I am so sorry to write this because at one point this was my favorite hotel in NYC, but I guess its been some time...I called before check-in because our train was stopped for nearly an hour entering the city, so we were going to miss the majority of the event we had traveled to attend. I asked the front desk if there was anything we could do to expedite the check-in process--could you flag the reservation? Could I give you my credit card# and email a ohoto of it over the phone and then show it when we arrive? Please, is there anything twe can do now to shave off even 5 minutes it would be helpful? The answer: a resounding "No". "Ma'am, we need to see your credit card and ID" (understandable) "And, if there is a line when you arrive, you will wait in that line behind the guests who've arrived before you". (understandable, but unnecessary to say!) When we did arrive, check-in was pretty fast and not at all warm, but there was thankfully no line. But all that call did was make us more anxious. We didn't feel welcomed and we didn't feel at all like the hotel cared about our business or hospitality. We missed the dinner at our event, so we ordered room service at about 10:30pm. It took 40 minutes (we were told 20 minutes), and then the kale salad we ordered arrived as a regular (very mediocre) caesar salad and the fries that came with the steak were undercooked and cold. the bread was stale and inedible. All for over $100 before fees.The next morning we made a breakfast reservation for 8am. We waited for over 40 minutes (along with at least 10 others) and finally asked if we could take a table we saw sitting empty. We were told the kitchen was backed up, so we ordered quickly, and waited ages for that food to arrive at all, and when it came, again, very sub-par for the setting and the price: cold soggy potatoes, and my sourdough toast was stale supermarket white bread from a bag. The bill for three of us was $125. For a 5 star hotel these rooms are tired. The shower is tiny, the toiletries are plastic wrapped and chintzy looking, and in the bathroom there are plastic wrapped paper coffee cups--not eco friendly, and not 5 star level. All in all, if you have something to do on the UES, the location can't be beat. The hotel is clean but lower your expectations about everything else-a once wonderful hotel is now a very average place.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Great location, not cheap. If you like walking through Central Park and mingling with visitors from many countries, the Park Lane will not disappoint. A variety of services are offered, but be aware that nothing is free. Bring a happy attitude and a fat purse and you'll be fine.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

The entire experience was bad right from the start. Checkin was not the right experience. Trying to get a hold of room service took many calls. Breakfast too 2.5hrs to get delivered. Called for toothpaste and never got it.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

If you hesitate to stay somewhere other than home during COVID, rest assure that Sanctuary NYC Retreats is a safe and rejuvenating get away.  It not only brought to us a completely safe environment; but also, the space and sense of a calm, quiet, restful enclave we needed to re-energize.  We will visit again soon and look forward to it so very much.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Rooms felt like rooms on a cruise ship, but thats NYC I guess.  In their efforts to minimize staffing through automation, they lost the human element and any sense of service or compassion.  I was charged for things I had no idea about until after checkout - I wouldn't have minded the fee's if I was aware to take advantage of the services.  I had a leaking ceiling above my bed (the whole building leaked when it rained) and was provided a new (duplicate) room, but little apology and zero compensation considering the entire night's sleep it cost me.

spray. There is no food on sight because the restaurant is under construction . I called Wednesday morning to let them know I would have to check out Thursday instead of Friday. Don’t matter that it was way before 25 hours in advance because I had been there since Monday. Still assistant on charging me $150 early check out fee. I have been a Diamond members for years never been treated like this

The Lowell is as close as we will ever come to having a New York townhome. The doorman greets us by name. The Concierge and Front Desk staff welcome us back as if we are old friends. The attention to detail is amazing - beautiful rooms and impeccable housekeeping.  We enjoyed dining in Majorelle and cocktails at Jacques Bar. The service in both was excellent.  We can’t imagine staying anywhere else in NYC - The Lowell is just perfect.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

This hotel was perfect. We spent 3 days here for my birthday so I could do all the Christmas stuff around a s it could not have been better. We were walking distance to everything and it was so convenient. The rooms were actual a decent size and very clean and comfortable. We had a slight problem with the room sage but it was dealt with quickly a she maintenance guy was personable and super helpful. Everyone at the front desk was so nice. And Samson was our go to for help with tours rides etc and he was fantastic. We will definitely be back and highly recommend this location
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Horrible, horrible, very small room: - Couldn't close the bathroom door without getting in the shower. - Window blinds very broken. - Minifridge non-functional and loud. - 1 foot clearance on one side and the foot of the bed. - Tricky to operate the HVAC system. - Very run down.  Unless you are exclusively going to performances at Lincoln Square, location is -- at best -- mediocre.  The only good thing was the staff.  Overall, far worse than a typical Manhattan hotel room in an older building. Which is reaaaallly saying something.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Broken elevator system in a 36-floor hotel: every time we had to get in or out, we had to budget at least 15 minutes simply to use the elevator. We ran into people swearing and cursing at the elevator system all through our stay.WiFi never worked at all (failed to connect) all throughout our stay.Tried calling the front desk via the room phone, and nobody answered on two separate days. Terrible service, and no way to get anyone to fix anything because they won’t answer the phone. Going downstairs in person was not a viable option because of the broken elevator system.Housekeeping did not replenish the soap in the shower (though they did enter the room).The rooms were tiny, even compared to Manhattan standards, but I won’t hold that against them.

Great location in the Theater District! Room is spacious and well-appointed, very clean. Really appreciate that they use permanent shampoo, etc. dispensers to avoid all the small plastic bottles that are so harmful to our environment!!

Gross, the hotel is full of black mould and they will not give me my refund. I got so sick I had to leave the hotel, I was assured by the manager I would recieve a refund I am still fighting for one after 6 weeks! They are liars and they allow patrons to stay in health hazardous conditions.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

I picked the hotel for its location.  I ended up in what was clearly supposed to be an ADA compliant room - lowered clothes rack, roll-in shower, extra bars around toilet, etc.  BUT they had put a sofa in the entry to the room, and the bed was large, so I question whether it would work for someone in a chair - just someone with mobility issues.  Everything was cut down - no closet, just a rack, a "desk that was a couple of inches wide, etc.  TV on the wall with a small shelf underneath.  But given what I wanted the room for, it didn't matter.  The bed was comfortable, and it was fine for one night.  There was a bit of noise from the elevated subway line that runs nearby -- but it would make it convenient to public transportation.  The desk was staffed by one person, so service was a bit slow - she seemed to be answering questions on the phone at the same time she was doing everything else.  It was rated three stars, and that seems fair - but I have paid about the same price for a higher quality hotel in other areas of the city.  I would probably only stay again if I had something within walking distance.…

Monique was so amazing, kind, and warm. The room is beautiful and everything is clean! There is an amazing view, ladies at the front desk were very helpful and awesome! We would definitely stay here again.

I've been meaning to write this raving review months ago!  My sister and I went to NYC for the 4th of July.  We had a fabulous stay at the Roxy!  Everyone was so warm and welcoming.  I don't know everyone's last names, but some of the employees we were impressed by were Lady, Jonathan, Donald, Roger, Kay, and Leo.  The rooms were nice, especially the retro rooms with turntables and albums. It was right next to a subway station which we took everywhere.  They all helped with the best way to get around NYC.  We'd definitely stay there again.

We are frequent guests of this hotel.  Its location cannot be beat.  The staff always goes above and beyond, and we feel like family every time that we return.  The hotel is always extremely clean, the beds luxurious and the rooms are fairly quiet (by NYC standards). Thank you to Rob-who is the best!

The staff was helpful, informative and kind.  The location is fantastic!  And the bed was super comfy.I had dinner in the restuarant Cognac. The bread was so good.  My wine selection was prefect with my meal.  I choose the Organic Scottish Salmon.  It was all amazing!

Staff was overly helpful nice and welcoming, from front desk to doorman, smiling, willing to make our stay amazing. Hotel room were very clean, modern. Everyone made us very comfortable and welcome, even my teenager adored her stay. Location was perfect. Christmas decoration was very cute.
Your task is to classify consumer hotel review into one of the following ratings: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"], where "1" indicates very dissatisfied and "5" indicates very satisfied.

Still no response from St. Regis.  I’ve called as advised.  Only for my call to continuously get passed around to no avail. When I finally spoke with Oscar, I described myself and the situation surrounding my visit. At first he didn’t recall our conversation.  Next, he chose to assume and insinuate that I was calling about my past experience and to complain.  He proceeds to tell me that I better not say I’m calling about a racial situation because he is a gay Latin or philliphino guy and he has NEVER encountered anything such as that from the staff there at the Regis.  I was appalled, to say the least. I proceeded to tell him why I was calling.  Which was due to our last conversation on my last visit this past January, where he advised that when I come back I can repeat my treat at no expense to me.  — That the Regis would apply the same accommodations as a credit for my return. He then proceeds to immediately cut me off and said that he now remembered me and that he would NEVER say such a thing. I was furious but maintained my professionalism, and this was difficult.  So then he becomes dismissive of my call when I explain that we’re planning a repeat of our last visit and reaching out to him as he had previously instructed.   He then tells me that what I’m stating isn’t possible but to proceed with putting it in writing to him.  I asked about a review with the upper management. Visiting NYC in midwinter imposes some limitations — when we were there, wind chills got close to 0 at times, so the location advantage of walking distance to Tribeca amenities and restaurants was significantly reduced.  When that happens, you rely on your hotel to step up.  In our case, the hotel restaurant — Henrietta — was a bit of a disappointment, probably because it competes with fuller establishments nearby.  The dinner menu was very limited and the dining area extremely chilly because the lobby’s outside doors fanned cold air across the first floor (the hallways aren’t heated, either).  The food was very good, just didn’t have many options, which might explain why there rarely was more than a small number of diners in it.  As premium elite members, we had access to the 21st floor club lounge, which was too small to accommodate the larger number of guests for morning breakfasts.  There’s a nice outside terrace connected to the lounge, but the winter keeps guests inside the small lounge. The meals there also did not stand up well to similar amenities we’ve had at other Sheraton properties — powdered eggs, reheated sausage links, wafer thin bacon, etc.  I strongly recommend Tribeca Bagels right next door for great breakfast items.  I was also surprised that the hotel registration desk was unable to break a $20 bill; I went to the small coffee stand in the lobby for change, but the cashier there provided it from his own pocket, not the register.  The bellmen were very polite and helpful.  Our accessible room had several good accessible features, esp the bath, but the king bed swallowed up all living space — anyone in a wheelchair or with a rollator would be unable to get around it or over to the windows.  The hotel does a poor job of handling the parking issue, a major challenge in Tribeca.  Its website only says “self park” for $55 a day, which means parking at the Wooster parking garage across the street and down the block.  I had hoped that Sheraton would’ve cut some kind of discount deal there, but no luck.Our stay was pleasant, but Sheraton needs to invest a bit more in this property’s restaurant and club lounge.

The woman at the till handed me an opaque bag to put my Burger King goodies in, "so no one would bother me" on my 50m walk back to the hotel, so not a good place at all! The manager also appeared to have a recalcitrant, abrasive nature, and resembled the infamous Whitey Bulger. The room was clean, however, and everything worked, so we double locked the door and slept comfortably until the airport shuttle the next morning. We booked it because of the price. Hotels were very high priced at the start of the 2019 holiday season and we found the Windsor on a booking website (that in itself was an issue since I was booking for 4 people, two adults, two teens. The booking website allowed four of us but the Windsor insisted we had booked a room for three people (I had confirmation for four) many emails between the Windsor and us and between the booking company and us and we were forced to "upgrade" for $35 per night to a larger room to accommodate the four of us. I should have cancelled then but rooms were outrageous the week we were planning to be there so I agreed to the the extra $35 a night and hoped for the best.   We were on the top floor (7, aka "The Penthouse") which I don't think had been rented in some time. It was FREEZING. The marble floor hurt to walk on but after our 4th day/night of having the heat on became bearable. The elevator opens directly into the room and that was weird and unnerving but ultimately was no big issue. Elevator cards didn't work well and had to be changed out several times. Unfortunately, the elevator also stopped working into our stay so we were forced to climb up and down the 7 stories.   The hotel is just tired and desperately in need of a good cleaning and some newer accoutrements. The 8 or 9 windows in the penthouse had old, dingy, bent and broken white mini binds and they looked horrible and did nothing to keep the light out (and there are a lot of lights on the rooftop terrace that are on all night long). The window on the opposite side of the room had the only curtain in the room and it was filthy and worn, shoved under the in window AC unit. None of the light fixtures had a full compliment of working lightbulbs, the floor lamp didn't work at all. There was a refrigerator and safe in the room (we didn't use the 'fridge so I don't know if it works or not). Wifi works. No coffee maker in room (no cups or plastic drinking glasses either). No coffee in lobby either (thankfully there is a decent store/deli on the corner for coffee and breakfast sandwiches/bagels).   Our room came with a King sized bed (very firm mattress) and a twin (lovely mattress) and we also had a rollaway (also a good mattress). All of the sheets were clean (flat and fitted) and there were extra blankets in a dresser which we needed the first and second nights while the room warmed up. Thankfully NO bedbugs (probably it was too cold for them!). Hot water took about 10 minutes to get to our room, but when it finally arrived it was nice and hot and we got two consecutive hot showers out of it. Towels were clean but old and scratchy. No washcloths or hand towels were provided.   Rooftop terrace (directly accessible from the penthouse and accessible via stairwell for the rest of the building) was the best part of the experience. Views of Lower Manhattan were fantastic, views of midtown were also good.  The Windsor is directly across the street from park and very close to subway. We walked all around the area into Chinatown and Little Italy, to the Brooklyn Bridge and 911 Memorial and the Battery. The Windsor Hotel was a good location for that part of Manhattan (a little trickier but easy to get to for Midtown and Uptown via Subway).  The staff were pleasant, but didn't go out of the way to be friendly or helpfuI. The last night the elevator was broken and since the elevator opens directly into the penthouse, we weren't sure how we'd get in the room. The front desk guy spent 5 mins on the phone with the manager before disappearing down the hallway. A few minutes later he came huffing and puffing down the stairwell as he'd run up to unlock the door from the rooftop terrace into our room. At midnight, after a full day of walking around Manhattan, the last thing we wanted to do was climb 7 stories of stairs, but we had to. We had to carry our luggage down those same stairs the next morning for check out. I doubt we'll stay here again unless management spends some time and money sprucing the place up.…

Worrying we were going to miss our ride, we felt we had no option other than to carry our luggage down 16 floors to the reception. Truly the worst place i've ever stayed in the world. I actually stayed here about 15 years ago and it's got so much worse, as standards elsewhere have improved. So the good: Chelsea is an awesome place to stay, and the hostel is as cheap as you can get in this area. The good ends there. The rooms are like a prison. There's basic and there's basic, and this is really basic. An absolutely horrible place to spend the night. Keys don't work well at all. Common spaces are lifeless. There's no buzz or communal feel you normally get with a hostel. Very narrow stairs. Worst, I think, are the staff. The level of antagonism is staggering really. The best you'll get is a stern stare. Never ever expect a smile or plesant word. When you check in (woe betide you if you're 2 minutes early), you're handed a list of instructions and told to pay. No other pleasant communication with staff at any point. Actually it got worse. I saw one staff member try to start a fight with someone staying here.  I know NY is crazy expensive, but I'd rather stay out of the city somewhere pleasant than here again. In fact, Id rather get arrested and spend the night in a cell. At least you're not paying to be abused.

The location is perfect, right opposite the WTC and Oculus Center and many Subway stations around.  Unfortunately this was not a pleasant hotel experience. We booked a room for 3. As we arrived, they told us they would upgrade our room to a Junior Suite without charge, so that we get better beds. We appreciated their offer and accepted. The room had no fridge and no mini bar. At the reception we were told that it was hotel policy, but if we wanted, they could get us a fridge, which they normally charge, but they would give us for free. The fridge never came… There was a weird smell in the bathroom and we couldn’t find out where it came from, until we used the shower: there was mold on the inside of the curtain and some unidentified yellow stains! (Really gross) There were only 2 drinking glasses on the table. These glasses were never replaced by clean ones till after the 3rd day when we kindly asked the maid to do so.  There were not enough hand and face towels for all of us. On the 2nd day we asked the maid for some more towels and she immediately gave us some. On the 8th day, we were left with only 3 bath towels and the maid told us that there were no more face or hand towels left. So for the next days we were supposed to dry our hands, face AND body with a bath towel.... The room was supposed to be a Junior Suite, but the furniture looked old and overused, most surfaces were scratched and discolored.  There were no accessible sockets on the bedside so when I moved the bedside table to find one and charge my phone, I discovered a lot of dust and hair which was certainly hiding there for months.  Under the bed couch, were my son was sleeping, we were confronted with the same situation: dirt, dust and hair which were not cleaned for months…. The room was in general not clean. And if you left a used tissue, or an empty chips bag outside the trashcan, you would find it at the same spot when you came back in your “cleaned” room.  At day 3 we had to buy liquid hand soap, cause the little hand soap we were using was never replaced...  For all the above, we paid 520$ per night....…

I was in this Soho House 'hotel' two days ago. It cost the price of a 5 star hotel, but it fails to deliver. The reception area is a tiny box just off the street, so there's always a crush at the desk, with only two cramped seats for customers available, the lighting throughout is too dark, so that wherever you are you can't actually see properly, including the floor numbers in the lift - everyone was always peering to see where to go. Our room was in an open access hallway with no extra security measures  (worrying) with very dark- bordello lighting so you could not actually see the room keyhole to get the key in. The room was small and again, with poor lighting. It is winter and the only heating was a fan that came out of a ledge that blew hot air into the room - so unless you wanted dry, dehydrating air and a loud helicopter noise in your room, you had to turn it off and freeze at minus-zero temperatures in a room with lots of exposed wooden flooring. The two windows with a block of wall in between let in sufficient light and room service was very poor - EVERY time I called for breakfast, they didn't pick up and I had to go through reception. The club at the top was fine but also very dark mood-lighting throughout the day, and service was off-on  in that most of the staff rush around but are very hard to pin down and the quality of food is negotiable for what it costs. I recommend giving this overpriced and under-delivering 'hotel' a wide berth.

This Hotel was always on my top favorite places to visit since it was the first St.Regis which would have to live up to its fame, glory and history… definitely be top notch… I believed. On our 5 day stay we were convinced otherwise. Having stayed as a loyal Titanium Bonvoy member in other St.Regis Hotels (e.g. Singapore) I had of course some kind of expectation, but this?   Checkin was chaotic and we didn’t receive half the info needed. There was no note or some kind of welcome in the room. After first contact with the butler service they just didn’t pick up the phone and didn’t call back. We tried every day and even after informing front desk no answer. We asked for a water cooker for tee, since there was no tea/coffee service. It was broken. So we had to order hot water for 8$ from the room service which magically worked fine.    Since we used our Bonvoy upgrade option, we got upgraded to a slightly bigger room next to the extremely loud and on weekends busy service elevators which I realized only after 2 sleepless nights. I talked to the reception that I would like to change our  room. The reception staff said that there was nothing available at this point and they would contact us until  14:00.   Guess what… I checked the Bonvoy App and there were 5 different room categories available for our remaining stay… ! So of course nobody contacted us until 15:00 and I again had to explain myself at the front desk.   Heureka, we got downgraded but at least we didn’t have to listen to the service elevator at night any more… amazing what small things can make one happy. Of course the butler service didn’t work on this floor as well.   Breakfast in the restaurant also could not live up to the St.Regis standard, I even had doubt if the salmon was fresh since the plate smelled heavily like fish.   Having paid an equivalent to about $1700 a night I can definitely not recommend this hotel, actually if I think about it…  unless there are some major changes I wouldn’t want to stay there even for free. DB…

I booked a stay here with my fiance for his birthday from Sept. 26-28th, 2020. Our room (number 21) was NOT equipped with an air conditioner, which made our visit far more uncomfortable than it should have been. The website stated that all rooms have an air conditioner, and I certainly would not have booked a room here if I had known there would not be one available. It is only September and the nights were extremely humid. Even worse, one of the windows did not have a screen, and so we risked letting bugs in if we wished for more ventilation in the room.We have both come to the Central Park North before, but this experience has truly made it unlikely that we'll come here in the future. The hotel should have notified us beforehand that an air conditioner was not available in this room, and offered us other room options or given us the opportunity to cancel our reservation. I had been looking forward to a comfortable couple of nights away from home with my fiance, but this wasn't what I received. We definitely did not get what we paid for. If you book a room here, be sure to confirm ahead of time with the staff that there will be air conditioning, because the website really can't be trusted.

This hotel was perfect for us! I read the reviews before I left and was a little worried about people's complaints but really, I had nothing to worry about. Check in was seamless, they took my credit card details and held $300 but this was a hold and not a charge. We were informed about the weighted fridge, but told that should we need to chill any items they could bring a small fridge to our room. Obviously we didn't have to carry our own suitcases up, these were brought to us. In addition to the weighted fridge there is also a weighted display on the surface top, this has water, crisps and biscuits on, anything that's removed for longer than 10 seconds will get charged to your room. The room itself was a great size, the bed was spectacular, my partner and I could both starfish and not be touching each other! It has a very comfortable mattress, we slept so well. Being on the 6th floor there was some noise from the street but this is unavoidable, it's New York, famously a very busy and loud city! Unless you're up 15 floors I expect some noise will be heard. The windows did an amazing job at blocking out about 80% but the bull horns on the fire engines/ambulances are LOUD! We didn't eat here because it was a touch pricy and to be frank we didn't come all the way to New York to eat in a hotel. There are 100's of places to eat all within a 10/20 minute walk, my advice would be to go out there and explore. If you come out of the hotel and turn right you will be walking towards times square itself, as well as Broadway. We booked The Lion King at Minskoff Theatre, literally 5 minute walk from the hotel, it was incredible. The shower was a little difficult to work out initially and the pressure is not the best, but it worked and was hot enough! I highly recommend this hotel both for location and for comfort, I would 100% stay here again

My wife and I spent a 3 night weekend at The Muse for her birthday.  We chose this hotel due to its great location for the activities we had planned.  We were disappointed in the value of this hotel and I will explain why.  First though, the room was clean, a decent size, and the bed was comfortable.  These are very important things for hotels to get right and the The Muse did this.  However, the most important thing for a hotel is for the guest to get a good night's sleep.    I booked an Executive King room and we were placed in room 1601.  With the sounds of the city below, we did not notice that the room is right next to the elevator motor room until that first night going to bed.  Loud clicks and bangs are heard every time the elevator is in use and given the hotel location next to Times Square and people out and about all night, these noises woke us up throughout the night.  We did not ask to change rooms the next day as the hotel was full and we had already unpacked and its a hassle to move.  I think the staff should be aware of this issue and make sure guests who are light sleepers have the option of a quieter room.  But when I informed the front desk staff about the noisy elevator, they were surprised.  I'm not sure if every floor has an elevator motor room or if we were just lucky to be next to the one on the 16th floor.  BTW, the mini fridge and toilet also make a bit of noise (the toilet must have been leaking as every few minutes it made a whining sound and then refilled.  I only noticed this the last day, so it wasn't a big deal and not reported to hotel staff.  I unplugged the mini fridge to solve that problem).  Additionally, the hotel charges a $40 per day amenity fee.  This was not explained to me at check-in though I was aware of it when I booked the room months before.  It seems the only "amenity" was some coffee and apples in the lobby, which we did not partake of.  The bar is closed, permanently it appears, and there is no food available.  On a rainy morning, it would be nice to get a bite of food at the hotel but this is not possible at the Muse.  So, at over $500 per night, without even the option to get a nightcap, this hotel was a poor value.  The room was nice and clean and the bed comfortable, but the other factors significantly took away the enjoyment of this property.   It's a great location so it's a shame the hotel-controlled factors affected our stay.…

This stay had everything to be good, but it wasn’t. Let's start at the beginning: I had to pay my stay in advance (a month and a half before the booking), for that, I needed to exchang emails and call six times until someone answered the call, for finally guarantee it. Then, when I arrived, after 11PM (I had told them in advance), they couldn't find my booking... apparently someone had already checked in, but it wasn't me. They eventually found the booking and gave me the card to access the room. When I arrived, there was a jumper on the bed and the locker was occupied. I went to reception to be allocated another room, and the receptionist said they were overbooked (you should never say that in the presence of customers!!!) and the system was slow. That the system was slow would be acceptable, that they were overbooking and had given the room to someone else by mistake would not. It was after 11PM, I was really tired, I just wanted to go to bed and somehow I was afraid I wouldn't have a place to sleep, even though I had paid for everything a month and a half before. The girl passed the problem on to a colleague at reception, who abruptly gave me another card and gave me the receipt. I told them that I should be compensated for everything that had happened; if it had been the other way round, they would have demanded everything from me. Another girl of the reception said that this was a hostel and that I literally couldn't expect to be looked after like in a hotel, they also told me that I was being rude for demanding something, considering their mistakes and they even laughed in my face of this situation. None of the four people on reception apologised to me for what was happening. I went to my room, everything was fine, I could rest. Or I thought I could rest... On the second night, at 1.30am, the same staff who had been unpleasant to me on my arrival came to the bed I had been allocated with the torch on his mobile phone and said "I think you might be in the wrong bed". I woke up startled.  I showed them the receipt, they asked me for taking it with them, I said no, they said they'd take a photo, but I didn't notice they’ve done it. They left the room. However, I couldn't sleep for the rest of the night… it totally freaked me out. The next night (my third night), another girl from reception who I'd never seen before turned up at the same time (1.30am) with the same questions. I thought that, the staff from the nights before, decided to make fun with here and made her going to my room for bullying me. I asked one of the girls in the dormitory, an American, if this was normal in this country? I came from another country and from another culture, these behaviours seemed horrible to me... but that could just be me. She told me that none of this was okay and no, it wasn't normal. On the fourth night, before going up to the room, I went to the reception I asked if I was going to be disturbed again… they said I wouldn’t. On the fifth and sixth night, there were no problems. However, this was probably the worst experience I’ve ever had with staff. Perhaps, like the girl from the reception from the first night said: this is a hostel, you can't expect five-star service! I disagree, people choose hostels, not because they're cheaper, but for the experience itself, which would otherwise be impossible to have in hotels. Good manners and friendliness is something that is transversal to public service in general; if you don't like the job, change. Now, don't you dare bully customers for demanding efficiency and competence!…

Maintenance was notified- They supposedly came while we were not in the room and fixed it but the problem was never fixed. This was reported to management (Eric) where I was told they would look for another room for us and would get back to me, no one ever contacted  me again. We were  so excited to stay here again, but was very disappointed with the room accommodations, the cleanliness of the room, and just the basic necessity of having hot water without waiting for 10 minutes. The location is convenient, and the hotel makes no claim to be five-star, but even so, the place was a disappointment.  There are no public spaces, and I was on a floor that could not even be reached by elevator.  I had to hike up stairs with luggage.  Most annoying was a $20/night hidden junk fee -- hotel services "destination" fee -- for a hotel which by design OFFERS NO SERVICES.  It's a basic place in mid-Manhattan, which is, I guess, a "destination."  But nothing Manhattan about the place.  Views are exclusively of a blank wall.  And with all the add-ons and the taxes on the add ons, the price is not lower than. competing hotels that DO offer amenities, lobbies, work areas, staff, This one does not even have a plastic cup in the bathroom or anywhere in the room for washing down a pill, So the relatively low price shown on Trip Advisor and other sites is misleading.  Nothing horrible.  Just a vivid example of why hidden junk fees for absolutely no benefits are an insult to customers, and we should not accept them as normal.

Here's my first one-star-review ever!  First the back story:  My wife and 9-yr-old son booked this hotel for a Mother-son vacation in New York City.  They booked online--three nights in October 2022.  When they checked-in, they soon started having some concerns about their safety and also the comfort of the room.  First, the room door was already open a crack when they first checked-in.  Second, the faucet in the bathroom was hyper sensitive and it was difficult to get it to set at anything besides straight cold and way-to-hot.  Third, the room was so narrow that in order to get to the other side of the room, they just about had to crawl over the bed.  My wife called me concerned that she and my son did not feel safe, particularly with the room not being secured prior to their arrival.  Of course I worried as well.  I immediately called the front desk and explained that my wife's plans changed and they would need to check out early.  The front desk clerk said she would see if the manager would permit that, she said she would call back.  She did and she reported that they would be able to check out the next morning and receive a refund of the last two nights.  All good so far.  The next morning when they were checking out, my wife asked for a copy of the invoice.  The clerk said one would be emailed to her.  My wife and son checked in to another hotel and enjoyed the rest of their vacation in NY.  Now the frustration.  My wife never received an emailed invoice but when we received our credit-card bill, the full three nights were charged on it.  I immediately reached out to the hotel.  The front desk staff directed me to the manager's email address.  I emailed the manager explaining the whole story.  I did not receive a prompt reply.  When I eventually did receive a reply, it appeared that the manager had not understood what I was asking.  I responded back, reiterating the situation and requesting a refund for the final two nights.  No response.  We decided to contest the charge through the credit card company.  The hotel was very active in responding to American Express.  They finally provided a copy of the invoice stating my wife and son stayed the full three nights.  AMEX affirmed the charges based on the invoiceI ended up calling Choice Hotels (the parent company) to request a refund.  Choice Hotels expressed regret at our experience but noted they could not help us because by this time, more than 90 days had passed and their policies prohibit refunds beyond that time frame.We definitely do not recommend the hotel based on its safety and poor state of maintenance.We definitely do not recommend the hotel based on how the Hotel staff failed to honor their agreement to allow my wife and son to check out early.We are out more than $500 for the two nights my wife and son did not stay and we are not happy :-(

I was coming to NYC for one night, solo.  I just needed something in upper midtown area for a reasonable price.  I've been to NYC many times, but for some reason just stumbled on this hotel.  Over the years, I've stayed a lot in Times Square area--which I like for the security and "open all night" aspects, but hate the traffic.  In recent years, for business reasons, I have trended more towards east mid-town, closer to GCS.  But that area has felt less safe/lively the last couple of years.  Many hotel rooms running $1000+ which is ridiculous.  There is almost nothing they could provide to make that worthwhile.  So I decided to give Carnegie Hotel a try.  It met every expectation. --Small, as expected--but I thought the room was well laid out and it did not feel cramped for me.  (One person, one night trip, not a lot of luggage.) --Good A/C, a must for me--I can't sleep hot --Bigger bathroom than you might have thought.  Very functional. --Water in the fridge--great when I arrived at 11pm, because I was thinking I"d need to go outside to get it. --Fridge in the room --No coffee maker, but I don't use those anyway --Plug conveniently located ABOVE the nightstand, where you can reach it. --Good lighting, no tricks to finding it --No view--but I didn't plan to stare out the window much.  It where I was (703), it was quiet. --As others have said, breakfast area was small--but I went at 7:30am and found a seat.  Everything was there, coffee, cereal, fruit, pastries, cheese omelets (pre-cooked).  Perfectly fine breakfast--and getting a breakfast at all here is a little unusual, at least where I've been staying. --Extremely reasonable price.  (Of course, taxes etc. add close to 40% of the listed rate--but that's true everywhere.) --Small hotel, but front desk manned at 11pm. --Iron, safe and hair dryer in room --Good wifi --Good, central location (thought that's true of most Manhattan hotels) --The room I was in was exactly as pictured  I have no negative comments.  I will note that they charged $50 at checkin to "hold" for incidentials--but I couldn't see anything to buy (no room service or minibar), so assume that's just a cash management tool.  If I get it credited back in the next day or two, no big deal.…

With its exquisite designs and hospitality fervor, the Greenwich Hotel in Tribeca spells:'Welcome to our Oasis". It has a design affinity to top up the nooks and crannies of the property with bespoke "Old  World Craftmanship " whether that's Parisian hand carved millwork, one of a kind Tibetan rugs, English leather furnishings, Carrara marble, Moroccan tile, Italian palazzo terra cotta flooring, a 250 year old farmhouse imported from Japan and all manner of the artisan from far flung corners of the world. Each room is uniquely differentiated but I relished my spacious Courtyard Suite  with exceptional  sitting area that promoted a cozy aura to the surroundings. The bath was exceptional with a large walk-in rain forest shower, deep soaking tub, dual basin marble vanity and full compliment of accoutrements befitting a hotel of this caliber. There are 2 venues for eating and drinking: The Drawing Room and Locanda Verde. The former is an exclusive amenity for hotel guests that offering a quiet atmosphere to drink and dine from the Locanda Menu. The Locanda is a bustling tavern-styled facility serving Italian food-fare. The menu is seasonal but you are bound to find star items like My Grandmother's Ravioli and Sheep's Milk Ricotta. I went with my old stand by: Lamb Chops, but I did muster up some Liver Mousse. An exemplary amenity is the Shibui Spa: a luxurious facility that  has it all.......from beautiful lounges to unique treatments for all kinds of revitalizations and opens up to an incredible pool with access to a top-notch gym center.So if you like luxe to the max, embedded with an old world aesthetic and a sanctuary ambiance..........then try the.........Greenwich Hotel..........an exquisitely designed property.

I am a member of the Accor Fidelity Program (now ALL) for about 20 years, when it began. I stayed hundreds of times in the Accor hotels all over the world for more than 30 years, with good satisfaction most of the time. But this time, I must admit that this hotel not only do not deserve the Sofitel brand, but has a shi**y service which I could not think was possible at this price level ! First, when you enter you get in a desert corridor, nice and warm, but with nobody to welcome you and tell you that the reception is hidden in the back. You feel very welcome ! I was checked in by a very nice and polite senior guy. And that's it. The room is old but very comfortable. I arrived at 10pm after a long flight and needed to drink a good beer and get a light room service dinner. Not only you have NO MINIBAR (check the room prices !!!) but the room service stopped at 10:15pm (the restaurant at 9:30 pm !). I could not believe it. I had to walk outside to have dinner. In the morning, late wake-up : no coffe machine in the room. Since I never have breakfast and just an expresso coffee, I checked the room service and finally got a 28 USD proposal for 1 coffee and 1 croissant. Which is just totally crazy. And with an expexted time of delivery of.... 30 to 45mn !!! LOL x10 I decided to go downstairs to have an expresso at the bar, but after the breakfast closed at 10am, the bar is not available either !!!! I had to go outside again just for a cup of coffee at a regular price, not a 20 USD small cup of coffee. In the evening, I had a very good dinner at the Gaby restaurant, with nice service, I can sincerely admit it. The service, in general, was ok, but really not what you can expect from the Sofitel brand (neither the room quality, decor and amenities), especially at that level of price. The staff seemed bored and not really guest oriented (with exception of course). This was my worst experience with an Accor hotel in more than 30 years, and it made me really think about changing my default travel hotel chain, because if they can accept this kind of unacceptable level of service under their name, this must mean that they have a SERIOUS problem. Will NEVER come back again. An ex-Accor enthusiast guest who will reconsider his future choices for his numerous future travels. VERY UNHAPPY.  …

Where do I begin…. This hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in whilst on vacation. It is certainly the best hotel my partner and I have stayed in NYC and between us we have visited the city 6 times from Scotland.   We arrived in NYC on the 26th December for 10 days to get married all the way from Scotland.   When we checked into the hotel and mentioned this to the staff we were given a complimentary room upgrade with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building on the 17th floor. The staff at reception were lovely and made us feel extremely valued, their customer service was exceptional.   The hotel facilities were very modern, classy and made you feel very relaxed. The lobby bar was excellent as were the staff and the food. The rooftop bar was incredible. The view of the Empire State Building from inside and outside on the terrace was amazing. Again, the staff were also lovely and very welcoming and would always find you a seat during busy times. They really looked after their hotel guests.   The housekeeping service we received in our room was excellent and the little chocolates left by staff each time our room was serviced was a lovely touch.   The location of the hotel is great and is within a short walking distance to most of the main attractions and tourist spots including a 5 minute walk to the main hustle of Times Square.   The management staff in particular, Scott and Evan, could not have been more personal and welcoming and couldn’t have done anymore for you. From checking in all the way to checking out, we were made to feel extremely valued by all the staff at the hotel which added to our overall visit to NYC for such a special occasion. The staff at reception also took the time to ask about our wedding day and asked to see photos we had taken, great from the staff taking a genuine interest in their guests.   This hotel will be our first choice hotel for all our future visits to the city, in my opinion you will struggle to find better. Thank you to the staff at the hotel for making my partner and I feel so welcome and we are delighted we carefully researched hotels prior to booking because The Archer truly was the best.    Will definitely be recommending the hotel and will be back again in the near future!!…

This is the worst experience I ever had in a hotel. First of all, when I woke up at 6:30am because of the noise (rooms are not isolated as there is no ceiling in the cabins and are located in a corridor of 50 cabin rooms), I found 5 bed bugs on my pillow. I directly complained to the reception and, although they changed my room (they did not seem surprised though), they did not disinfect this room and gave it to another client the same day. Deliberately attributing someone a room infested by bed bugs when you are aware of it, is just unacceptable.In addition to bed bugs, rooms are cabin rooms and are much smaller than shown on the pictures, with no window except for very few rooms. All cabin rooms are located in a big room and are separated from each other by a fine wall and they have no ceiling. Anyone making noise can be heard in all other cabin rooms. Also, if someone turns on the light during the night, you will see the light in your room. All this makes it hardly possible to sleep after 6/7am in the morning even if you are a heavy sleeper.Finally, the hotel is extremely cold and they only give you a very thin blanket. I was freezing the first night, and had an interrupted sleep because of the cold (in addition to the noise and the light) so I slept with my coat, my scarf and two jumpers the night after.In conclusion, I can understand the history of this hotel (staff of The Bowery House has preserved and restored every detail of the remarkable 1940’s cabin craftsmanship and in turn provide unique, authentic and historic accommodations) but not at this price (~100USD per night) and not at the cost of the essentials of hygiene (bed bugs). Their motivation is definitively more cost saving than preserving the history of the hotel

This hotel is a nicely designed, functional downtown NYC hotel very well located for SOHO Shopping and downtown specific focused trips. The rooms are small but nicely designed and utilize space well. A single traveler or an urban couple used to tight quarters can make it work. The hotel bills itself a five star property, which it is most definitely not. Having stayed in many NYC hotels over the years, this is a nice, but unremarkable spot in the mold of many other boutique properties that have come and gone over a three to five year cycle, that will work for the right guest but actually could be great if only the management and staff wanted it to be. Service is unenthusiastic and without the five star polish you’d want for premium pricing. Dining is serviceable but not great, though the library workspace is a nice setup for travelers, especially since it will be hard to work from your room with such tight quarters. The hotel does not have a gym onsite which is a huge, and curious miss for a Marriott managed property of this size and profile. Overall I would give four stars, except for the lack of a gym, which knocks it down to three, and is such a foolish miss making it hard to envision personally booking there again until that changes. But I would happily recommend this hotel for single travelers who do not need many services, provided the rates are reasonable at the time and the guest had business or leisure plans in SOHO, NOLITA, or TRIBECA.

As you may have noticed, there are "mixed reviews" here regarding this hotel. I want to say that of course, each guest will have very individual preferences, needs, and desires, price comfort levels and expectations. We did notice a few inconsistencies when reading these reviews that concerned us, so we made sure to mention the reported  noise levels ask for a room much higher up (ahead of our stay) and we were immediately accommodated.  Now on to the good part: Super easy to find, fabulous location, staff super friendly and helpful! Tea and coffee in the lobby area until about 9:55 am each morning --  how nice! Keep in mind, this is a FOUR star hotel, and I'm rating it as Excellent "as such." It is a wonderful and affordable option for those of us who do not require luxury, but functionality and cleanliness.   Upon checking in (fast and easy) we went up to our room on the 20th floor at the end of the hall and found the room ready and very clean. A card was on the desk for us from Mgt wishing us a great time in the city and for us to have a comfortable and enjoyable visit.  The bathroom was NOT old, nor was it moldy. The room, while snug, was not restrictive. The safe in the closet was in what we considered the right spot and there was a foldable luggage rack in there to put your luggage on when unloading or storing, which we used. Our room had a King-sized bed with a sofa-type seat at the foot and across from it was the desk, chair, and the wall-mounted flat screen TV (which we did not use, as we didn't come to NYC to watch TV or hang out in our room.) The room itself "faced" other buildings and not the front street, but it's all good -- when in a city, EXPECT a city view, okay? The sirens were not NEARLY as bad as someone else said in a review, but yes, you'll hear them, though not intrusively.  The water pressure in our room was excellent and the water got HOT fast -- we loved it. The bed was comfortable and the mini-appliances, which are arranged on a wooden shelf unit, were very helpful to us. There is a Whole Foods Market about five minutes walking distance (on Madison Ave) and we bought fresh fruit and other snacks to keep in our room in between eating out, and for our breakfast (we didn't eat the breakfast in the restaurant due to our dietary restrictions). Our friends, whom we met for the long weekend, were on floor 16 and loved their room, telling us it was clean and QUIET.  Other than the "Sorry for our construction" state of affairs on the main level (and isn't that actually a good thing, to see renovations in progress?) I can think of NOTHING that went wrong and no question that wasn't answered by the staff correctly. (Special shout-out to Richard and Gil)  Upon checking out, we were able to store our carry-on bags with the front desk (they have a room for this purpose and one can also leave them there if arrival time doesn't match the check-in time) and it rained one evening while we were in town and got a loaner umbrella as well!   We needed a way back to LGA to catch our flight home on Monday and the man at the front desk told us that while they can't call a taxi cab for us, they have an arrangement with a private company. He showed us a rate of $63 for the trip from the hotel to LGA, which was within mere dollars (two-fifty more than our trip from LGA using a city yellow cab) so we went with that and were able to schedule it for exactly when we needed it. The ride ended up being $73 and not $63, but both of us believe that it's because the vehicle that arrived to pick us up was a huge GMC Yukon -- smooth, safe ride and our driver was a really good fellow, too! So, it was well worth the unexpected $10 extra for a ride where we weren't stressing over a rental car, navigating unfamiliar streets, and trying to merge into the airport, etc etc.  Our time with HGI Midtown was really smooth, easy, and enjoyable. I hope your stay will be, as well!  …

We stayed at the Westin from 1st Jan 2024 to 7th Jan 2024. The location is great, next to the Subway, lots of fast food stores, so after a long day walking, you can grab some and take back to the room, Dallas BBQ restaurant which is close by, was enjoyed by everyone.The staff we spoke to were mostly very nice, some, just OK (bit annoying when your are still having to tip them!)We arrived at the hotel at 3pm, we had booked 2 rooms and neither ready, that is fine we were 1 hour early for checkin. Reception said it could be an hour. At 5pm we went back to the hotel to checkin. One room was ready and couldn't give me a time on the second, went back each hour to check and eventually got into the room at 8pm!, my 2 children and I had been up since 4:30am UK time, so it was 1am for our body clocks, we got an apology, but no offer  of room credits like others have mentioned, I would have thought a 4 hour delay, for a room that has been booked since March 2023 would deserve some form of compensation, question's for management, how do you determine who you give room credits to? why is this offer not for every customer you have inconvenienced, how do you choose who gets it??? The hotel knew in advance how many guests were staying on the 1st of Jan, so maybe should have factored that into the house keeping rota's - greed perhaps? The room itself was good, nice beds and shower and plenty of room. The views were also great and the WiFi was excellent.We did breakfast once and only once, it was pretty poor for the amount they charge, think Travel Lodge in the UK, budget hotel basic breakfast and way better than we got. The kids were happy their teeth were still in tact after trying to eat the bacon. And all of the kids said "we don't want to eat there again"The bar was OK, we used our room credit for cocktails one night.Checkout was quick and the door men were very friendly, always a hello when you got back to the hotel.All in all if you ignore the ridiculous amount of time they take to get your room ready, the hotel was nice. I suppose I should read more into reviews before I book, as there were a few recent reviews for this hotel that were quite poor, lesson learnt!, would I book this hotel again - no, I think having to wait 4 hours for a room that you have paid for with no reimbursement is shocking, If I had stayed beyond check out time by 4 hours, I am sure I would have been made to pay a late check out fee -  manager, would this be correct?

This was my first time staying at a Virgin property, and I don't think I will be back. Although the hotel is new and very clean, I did not like the way the rooms were arranged. The room is basically split down the middle, with a bedroom at one end, and closets, sink, separate shower, toilet, and a small makeup table on the other. There is a sliding door that can be left open or closed. The room lacked additional seating areas. You either sat on the bed or a small stool near the makeup table. The room is separated so that one person can get up and get dressed without disturbing the other person sleeping. But once you went into the other area, there was no place to sit and have coffee or just hang out. I felt this design made the room feel smaller. The other issue I had with the hotel is a missong wallet and lack of concern from the hotel staff. The night before  we were checking out, I realized my wallet was missing. It had all of my credit cards and drivers license in it. I had left it on the bed that morning while in a rush, but when we came back to the room, the bed had new sheets and the wallet was gone. I suspected it was rolled up in the sheets and tossed in the laundry area. I immediately called the front desk to explain the situation. I was told that someone would get right back with me. Several hours went by and 2 more calls to the front desk, but I never was able to speak with house keeping or security. The next morning I called the front desk 2 more times, until finally security came to our room at 11 am, after I complained that we had to leave for the airport at 12 and I did not have an ID to board the plane. Security was no help at all. He wrote down a few notes and said he was going to make some calls and get back with us ASAP. By 12 we went down to the lobby to get a car for the airport. The security guard was chatting with other guests and basically just hanging out in the lobby. We made eye contact and I was walking over to ask him about the status of my wallet, when he hurried away and went into a room for employees only. I did not expect the hotel to find my wallet, but I did expect them to at least try and locate it, or communicate with us better. There are many hotels in New York, and I just feel the Virgin is lacking in customer service, which is why we will choose a different one next time we visit the city. …

Took my family to NYC for a 6-day trip last week.  I chose Four Points Sheraton in Downtown since we wanted to see the statue of Liberty and 9/11 memorial.  We got to the hotel at noon, a little too early for check-in.  Ralph found us 2 rooms and allowed us to check-in early and get ahead of our sightseeing.  You can also ask to leave your bags in the lobby if your room is not yet ready. The rooms are clean and well stocked.  Our rooms were cleaned daily except when we requested to skip us.  The location of the hotel is very close to Fulton and WTC subway stations.  We used the subway lines to get to all the sites we wanted to see Uptown.  There’s a grocery store nearby for quick bites and essential supplies.  There are plenty of restaurants around with varying price points.  Brooklyn Bridge is within walking distance for souvenir shopping.  There’s a good Italian restaurant next to the hotel which we visited a few times.   We’ll definitely consider Four Points Sheraton in Downtown for our next trip to NYC.
